Koalicija načelno podpira Šabedrov predlog za ukinitev dopolnilnega zavarovanja
05 Nov 2019, 13:24 by STA

Minister za zdravje Aleš Šabeder je predstavnikom koalicije danes predstavil predlog za ukinitev dopolnilnega zdravstvenega zavarovanja in uvedbo obvezne pavšalne dajatve, ki bi se stekala na ZZZS. Stranke predlog, ki je le prvi korak k prenovi plačevanja zavarovanja, načeloma podpirajo in se strinjajo, da ga v postopek vloži vlada.



Minister za zdravje Aleš Šabeder je predstavnikom koalicije danes predstavil predlog za ukinitev dopolnilnega zdravstvenega zavarovanja in uvedbo obvezne pavšalne dajatve, ki bi se stekala na ZZZS.  Foto: STA

LJUBLJANA > Pričakovati je, da bo predlog novele zakona o zdravstvenem varstvu in zdravstvenem zavarovanju, ki predvideva ukinitev dopolnilnega zavarovanja, najprej romal na Ekonomsko-socialni svet, vlada pa bi ga zatem poslala v parlamentarni postopek.
Dodatno bi vključili še 100.000 prebivalcev
Po predlogu bi obvezno pavšalno dajatev plačevale vse poklicne in starostne skupine, ki so že doslej plačevale dopolnilno zdravstveno zavarovanje, dodatno pa bi vključili tudi okoli 100.000 prebivalcev, ki dopolnilnega zavarovanja zdaj ne plačujejo. Natančnega seznama slednjih še nimajo, vendar na ministrstvu ocenjujejo, da je to predvsem mlajša populacija, ki vstopa v aktivno dobo, ter en del starejše populacije, je v izjavi v DZ pojasnil Šabeder.
Višina nove obvezne dajatve je po njegovih navedbah še stvar razprave koalicijskih partnerjev. A po sedanjih predvidevanjih ne bo presegala višine prispevka, ki smo ga plačevali pred zadnjo podražitvijo dopolnilnega zavarovanja, to je okoli 31 evrov, je zatrdil.
Denar se bo stekal na Zavod za zdravstveno zavarovanje Slovenije
Dajatev bodo odvajali od neto plače oz. prejemka, stekala pa se bo na Zavod za zdravstveno zavarovanje Slovenije (ZZZS) v obvezno zdravstveno zavarovanje. Košarica pravic se po ministrovih zagotovilih ne bo spreminjala. Prav tako zagotavlja, da je predlog finančno vzdržen.
Poudaril je, da z načinom odtegljaja od neto plače ne bodo dodatno obremenjevali prispevkov delodajalcev in delojemalcev. To je ena bistvenih razlik predloga v primerjavi s predlogom Levice, o katerem bosta v sredo razpravljala pristojna parlamentarna odbora. Glede na napovedi koalicije je pričakovati, da bo predlog zavrnjen, kar pa bo, kot kaže, zapečatilo sodelovanje Levice z vlado.
Predlog ministrstva za ukinitev dopolnilnega zdravstvenega zavarovanja bo po predvidevanjih začel veljati z začetkom leta 2021, dotlej pa bi pripravili še solidarnostno lestvico plačevanja dajatve in zakon o dolgotrajni oskrbi, ki bo prav tako najverjetneje prinesel novo dajatev.

In principle, the Coalition supports Shabeder's proposal to abolish supplementary insurance
05 Nov 2019, 12:24 by STA

Health Minister Ales Saber today presented to the coalition representatives a proposal to abolish supplementary health insurance and to introduce a compulsory flat-rate tax, which would be based on the Health Insurance Institute. The parties, which are only the first step in the renewal of insurance payments, in principle support and agree that it is submitted by the government.



Health Minister Ales Saber today presented to the coalition representatives a proposal to abolish supplementary health insurance and to introduce a compulsory flat-rate tax, which would be based on the Health Insurance Institute. Photo: STA

LJUBLJANA> It is expected that the proposal to amend the Health Care and Health Insurance Act, which envisages the abolition of supplementary insurance, would first make a pilgrimage to the Economic and Social Council, and the government would then send it to parliament.
An additional 100,000 inhabitants would be included
According to the proposal, the mandatory flat-rate benefit would be paid by all occupational and age groups that had previously paid supplementary health insurance, and would also include about 100,000 residents who do not currently pay supplementary insurance. They do not yet have an exact list of the latter, but the ministry estimates that this is primarily a younger population entering the active age and one part of the older population, Saber explained in a statement in the National Assembly.
The amount of the new mandatory levy is, according to him, a matter for discussion by coalition partners. However, according to current forecasts, it will not exceed the amount of the contribution we paid before the last increase in supplementary insurance, which is around 31 euros, he said.
The money will be transferred to the Health Insurance Institute of Slovenia
The benefit will be deducted from the net salary or salary. and will go to the Health Insurance Institute of Slovenia (ZZZS) for compulsory health insurance. The Basket of Rights, according to the Minister's assurances, will not change. It also ensures that the proposal is financially sustainable.
He emphasized that the deduction from the net wage would not put an additional burden on employers 'and employees' contributions. This is one of the essential differences between the proposal and the proposal of the Left, which will be debated by parliamentary committees on Wednesday. According to coalition forecasts, the proposal is expected to be rejected, which appears to seal Levica's involvement with the government.
The ministry's proposal to abolish supplementary health insurance is expected to enter into force from the beginning of 2021, with a solidarity scale for the payment of benefits and a long-term care law likely to bring a new benefit.
